column4: I once installed a package named 'kubuntu-desktop'
this made the usplash image to be blue.
by default it has been brown.
then I did the same with xubuntu-desktop
then the boot image was gray
I want the boot image to be brown again.
how do I achieve this ?
torpor fdisk ?
torpor r do you mean the 'logical volume manager' ?
i don't know what i mean, i just remember that there was some GUI tool for formatting a newly added disk to the system ..
torpor there's gparted - a partition editor with GUI
and this lets me format, etc?
it also allows to format the partitions you create with it
thanks.
i'll look it up and use it ..
torpor apt-get install gparted
I don't know if I am like you... are you a good thing to be alike ?
ok
thanks for the help everyone, i really appreciate it ..
torpor paypal, donate ... duh
already bought ubuntu a few times!
